ranked_diseases.explanation: Waardenburg Syndrome, Type 1 is a genetic disorder often characterized by sensorineural hearing impairment and sometimes delayed speech and language development due to hearing loss.
Usher Syndrome, Type 1B is associated with sensorineural hearing impairment and may lead to delayed speech and language development. It generally has an early onset.
Pendred Syndrome presents with sensorineural hearing loss and can lead to developmental delays in speech and language due to impaired hearing.
Alport Syndrome is characterized by sensorineural hearing impairment and may include delayed speech development due to hearing issues.
